item.title: Large fly tip by the station, 16th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westerley Crescent, Perry Vale, London

item.title: Very large tree leaning towards property causing damage to pavement and putting property at risk, 16th June
item.description:
I have raised this issue before as has my neighbour before me. The tree is too large. it is leaning dangerously towards property. the height of the tree indicates the roots which are large enough to be causing subsidence to our property. I can’t see through my bedroom window due to the tree. It covers everything in sap so damages my car and my daughters car who park on our driveway The branches are overhanging and so low that they have caused my 95 year old father to stumble and fall. He is frail and in danger of real harm. The lean is so severe I cannot reverse my car from my driveway on the right hand side. The tree blocks vision, causes harm is a risk to elderly and young, has damaged the pavement outside our property also causing a trip hazard and very serious safety risk. I am increasingly worried about the roots damaging my property and likely my neighbours. I have been told that Bromley council do not take down trees unless they are diseased however, a silver birch opposite in Ford Avenue has been taken down and many trees were taken down in Elmfiekd Road to allow for property developers - none of which were even slightly as large and obstructive and dangerous as the one outside my home (138 Palace View). For the safety of elderly and young people using Palace View, I must ask once again for this tree to be removed before a really awful accident results.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palace View, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A lot of household waste in bag and loose left by residents, 16th June
item.description:

item.title: Rat issues in alleyway running behind 41-85 Royston Road, 16th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Royston Road, Penge, London

item.title: Fly tipping on the corner of Doon Street, 16th June
item.description:
Someone has flighted white goods, possibly a freezer or fridge on the corner of a very narrow pavement. Potentially dangerous for children if they were to start playing with it because it’s very rusty or they could get themselves locked in and suffocate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 115, Stamford Street, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet
